page.title: 20Sparham Estates
page.content:
Sparham Hall is an irregular ten-bay house, built in 1856 for Â£736 it replaced a brick Manor House when this was part of the Holkham Estate. It stands in its own grounds with views over the River Wensum and water meadows. Sparham House is a five-bay Georgian House built about 1820. Both these houses are homes of the Sayer family, local landowners and keen conservationists. In 1969 the Sayers bought 20 acres of land, previously worked as gravel pits, to revert the area to its natural state. Leased to the Norfolk Naturalists Trust, the pits were flooded and now Sparham Pools provides a natural habitat for animals, birds, insects and flora.
W.I. Contributors :- Mrs J Mumby Mrs M Roy Mrs C Haigh Mrs G Page (photographs)
